unnormalised: IIT Delhi has announced a new M.Tech program in AI, starting from the academic year 2024-25. The program aims to equip students with skills in areas like ML, DL, and NLP. Interested candidates can apply online before 30/06/2024. The application fee is Rs. 500 for general category candidates.
normalised: I-I-T Delhi has announced a new M-Tech program in A-I, starting from the academic year two thousand and twenty four to twenty five. The program aims to equip students with skills in areas like M-L, D-L, and N-L-P. Interested candidates can apply online before thirtieth june two thousand and twenty four. The application fee is rupee five hundred for general category candidates.

unnormalised: Prof. Rajan Kumar, the program coordinator, stated that the curriculum includes courses on advanced algorithms, data mining, and AI ethics. He further added that the program will also have industry collaborations, offering internships and projects. Students with a B.Tech degree in CS or EE are eligible to apply.
normalised: Professor Rajan Kumar, the program coordinator, stated that the curriculum includes courses on advanced algorithms, data mining, and A-I ethics. He further added that the program will also have industry collaborations, offering internships and projects. Students with a B-Tech degree in C-S or E-E are eligible to apply.

unnormalised: The program will initially have an intake of 60 students. The total course fee is Rs. 4 lakhs. The institute is also offering scholarships to deserving candidates based on merit and financial need. The classes will be held at the IIT Delhi campus located at Hauz Khas.
normalised: The program will initially have an intake of sixty students. The total course fee is rupee four lakhs. The institute is also offering scholarships to deserving candidates based on merit and financial need. The classes will be held at the I-I-T Delhi campus located at Hauz Khas.

unnormalised: AI experts predict that this program will boost India's AI talent pool. A recent NASSCOM report estimates that India needs at least 1 million AI professionals by 2025. The program aims to address this demand by providing quality education and training in the field of Artificial Intelligence.
normalised: A-I experts predict that this program will boost India's A-I talent pool. A recent N-A-S-S-C-O-M report estimates that India needs at least one million A-I professionals by two thousand and twenty five. The program aims to address this demand by providing quality education and training in the field of Artificial Intelligence.
